basic.description: This course provides a basic understanding of adolescent development as it relates to human growth development and learning through a multi-disciplinary perspective. Biological, cognitive, and psychosocial tasks of adolescence within contexts such as family, peer group, school, community, culture and other learning environments are examined.
basic.subject: CHD
basic.title: Adolescent Contexts

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisites: Major status and junior standing.
